column4: please could someone help me, I'm helping a friend to install ubuntu dapper in his pc however during the install in the "select keyboard layout" screen it doesn't show any model to select, so we can't select to forwad the instalation...
In step 3 out of 6
did you check to make sure the disc is good? I had alot of trouble with ubuntu install discs for some reason my burner didn't likem (which is wierd cause it fine on everything else)
thanks I'll check!
yeah its really wierd that it happened too cause my cd burner hasn't botched more then 1 disc in about 3000 burns too till the ubuntu isos
maybe my powersupplys dying or memory or something hrm I should check that
wile using the live cd it doesn' use anything from the hd?
shouldn't have too unless you mount something
so if he had made a missinstall of ubuntu before, it won't affect anything in a new instalation?
missinstall
does he have another os on the machine and did he rewrite the partitions changes on the new install?
he formated the partition that he installed ubuntu, it used to be a ntfs partition
you may wanna setup your partitions again and write them to disk just in case (although the missing keyboard stuffs probably have nothing to do with that)
but he's using the liveCD to install... if he installs via terminal it would output any possible errors? if so, what's the command to start the installation?

sorry bout that the wife =P uhm installer from live cd I don't recall really I've installed it 3 times in the last week or 2 and I don't remember if I started it from the commandline or the live cd (installed a few others too)
they're all becoming a blur (gentoo, debian, arch, ubuntu installer cds although the gentoo one looked tasty I must admit)
ok ^_^ , thanks for the info!
np I have run into trouble with deb installs w/out rewriting my paritions when they've failed in the past so I suspect ubuntu may have similar issues (tho its just a guess)
the ubuntu installs I've done came off w/out a hitch once I got a good cd burned
good luck =)
terminator font
jk heh
thanks, I think that the problem is the CD also
